resources.string: TicTacToe² is just like any other TicTacToe game but it’s got a bit of a twist. Your main board will have a bunch of boards inside of it. Player 1 (the player who goes first) will pick which inner board they wish to play in, and will then play somewhere in that board like regular TicTacToe.

Player 2, however, will be moved to a different board matching where Player 1 played. For example: if Player 1 chose the top left board but plays in the middle cell, Player 2 will be moved to the board on the middle.

Once a player wins a board, eg Player 1 with the top left board, the main board will now show an X (or an O, depending on the winner) where it used to be empty. This means that the entire board has been won by that player. If you direct a player to a board that has been claimed, that player gets free choice to pick any board of their choosing. For example, if Player 1 won the top left board with a move in the top left cell, the top left board is complete so Player 2 can’t play there. Instead they get to choose any of the other available boards to play. The game will continue in this way until someone has won a regular TicTacToe win in the main board.

Now, before the game begins, you can select the names you and your friend wish to play under and even the size of the board. A regular TicTacToe² game has a depth of 2 (one main board and one inner board) and a main board size of 3 (3x3 grid). This can be modified to the user’s desire, however you can’t have a board of size 0. But otherwise if you wish to play a three hour long TicTacToe game with a depth of 6 and a board size of 5, we can’t legally stop you.
